intro: Pentameris filiformis, commonly known as the slender pentameris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbelliferous plants, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
